The power was out most of the day in Clare, so a lot of the stores and restaurants remained closed. My plan was to spend the evening relaxing in the apartment, so aside from restaurants and shops closing from the power outage, it didn’t change much for me. However, from 6-11PM it sounded like a rave going on from a party at the event space. I’m a musician myself, so I don’t mind loud noise... just not when I am out of town for a relaxing weekend with my boyfriend. Unfortunately, it was impossible to relax with the constant booms from the music, the guests and cars dropping/picking people up outside on the street below, and noise from the DJ and loud voices at the party. (Keep this in mind if you’re looking for a quiet get away) Once the party ended, I was able to relax and unwind, and it was really nice watching the rainy night time view from the bay window. (The swivel chairs are a great touch!) In the morning I had to turn the noise machine on as there was some noise from people at the cafe below. I was hoping to have coffee and brunch at the cafe after checkout since it was closed upon our arrival due to the power outage, (I made changes to my schedule so we could have brunch before heading out), but the espresso machine was broken. (more of my bad luck for the weekend, haha) We really wanted coffee, so we did not go to the cafe. (I have ate at the cafe once before and it’s great!) Other than the noise, and unfortunate events that aren’t in anyone’s control, the space is beautiful, clean, well maintained, and a really great idea having the cafe, venue, and suites all together. Morgan does a great job with all of the businesses. I’d recommend the venue/cafe/upper suites to anyone, but I would be sure to make note about the noise from the event space/cafe as I could see some guests not being happy about that.

This is definitely a nice place to stay: the hosts go out of their way to provide snacks, entertainment, and even a local guide of things to do in the area. The home theater was wonderful!
However, I wouldn’t necessarily describe it as a hideaway. It’s advertised as an entire private space, which is only partially true. If you really want something private, this might not be the best space for you. The “free parking” is a cramped driveway shared with the several cars of folks who live there as well. You will be able to hear the hosts above you, and worry about them hearing you. If you are socially anxious or sensitive about encroaching on the space of others, I wouldn’t be able to recommend it fully.
It was a bit stressful for that reason, as well as the host’s messaging, which seemed passive-aggressive from the jump (no welcoming message, just a warning to not bring extra guests or drugs into their home, which obviously I had no intention of doing, but it set the stage for a somewhat uncomfortable experience).
Apart from that, we did have a nice kind-of getaway. If none of what I said applies to you personally (i.e. you don’t mind a shared space, or don’t struggle with feeling socially anxious) then I would definitely still recommend the space. However, for myself it definitely diminished my overall ability to unwind and enjoy some time away from home.
